Construction job shadowing
Sales surveys
Warranty workshops

Sales Department: A survey might be the best option. Given that sales employees are frequently in different locations and work different hours, a survey allows them to provide input and feedback at their convenience.

Warranty Department: A workshop would be suitable. Meeting in person to discuss job roles can be effectively done through interactive workshops where employees can engage in discussions and activities.

Background

VanArsdel, Ltd. builds custom homes. The company has one Azure tenant and uses multiple systems to manage the sales, construction, and warranties of the homes.

The company has three departments: sales, construction, and warranty. Sales, contract, and warranty information is not shared among the departments.

The owner of VanArsdel, Ltd. requires a consolidated system that the company can use to track each home’s progress.


Sales
-


Current environment
-

• Company employees use Microsoft Outlook for all communications.
• Company employees use Microsoft Word to create sales contracts.
• Employees in the sales department are frequently in different locations and work different hours from each other.
• Employees in the sales department use a Contracts team in Microsoft Teams to collaborate.
• The company uses a third-party marketing tool to update contacts every day.


Requirements
-

• Contacts’ names must be formatted before they are imported from the third-party marketing tool.
• The company must retain contracts for five years.
• The company requires that the sales department display the All Contracts view in Microsoft Teams.
• All contract information must be stored in the All Contracts view.
• Contracts must not be lost if a device is lost or stolen.


Issues
-

• Employees in the sales department store contracts on their local computers.
• The construction team receives a copy of a contract only when the sale of a home is complete.


Construction
-


Current environment
-

• Employees in the construction department use Project Online to manage schedules.
• Employees in the construction department use Microsoft Excel to manage costs of projects.
• The main supplier of construction materials provides an API to the company. The company uses the API to manage suppliers for projects in near real time.

-

• Employees in the construction department must be able to demonstrate how their work is performed rather than document their process.

• A field must sum up the costs of the materials.

-

• Employees in the construction department are unable to schedule resources because they are not informed of future projects.
• Employees in the construction department currently enter basic project information manually for each software application.

-

-

• The company requires that warranty claims be resolved in less than a month.
• The company requires that all claims be entered in the system along with their related issues.
• If a claim is found to be invalid, the company requires that the claim and its related issues be deleted.


Issue
-

• Employees in the warranty department report that they are frequently sent to homes without knowledge of what is in scope for the project.

-

• The new system must use the development and production environments.

discussion.content:
• Contacts’ names must be formatted before they are imported from the third-party marketing tool.
so answer is 
1)dataflow
2)virtual table

comments.content:
Why Dataflow for the marketing data?
Daily updates: The marketing tool updates contacts every day, and you can schedule or trigger a dataflow to run as frequently as needed.
Data transformation: You must format the contact names before they are imported. Dataflows allow you to use Power Query to clean and transform the data before loading it into Dataverse.
Physical storage in Dataverse: After transformation, the dataflow loads the contacts into a Dataverse table so they can be used in model-driven or canvas apps and included in Dataverse security, forms, views, etc.

Dataflow aligns with batch processing and transformations (Sales).

Custom Connector directly integrates the supplier’s API with no pre-built provider needed (Construction).

Virtual Tables are ruled out due to dependency on a data provider, which adds unnecessary complexity.

Confidence Level: 100%

discussion.content:
1. dataflow
2. virtual table or custom connector, would go with virtual table, but I am not sure, if or how you can do the sum up - custom connector would be async, so no "near real time"

comments.content: The second one is definitely "Custom Connector". You would create that to connect to the Supplier's API. That's the key there. It's a third party system and it doesn't identify what that system is. This rules out Virtual Tables not knowing if a virtual provider is available (although you could write your own, but not worth it). Of course #1 is correct: Dataflow.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. the project manager adds a testing plan

Selected Answer: A
A complete deployment plan should include a strategy for moving data from the old system to the new one. Therefore, the most direct way to resolve the issue of an incomplete deployment plan is to request that A. the IT manager adds a data migration strategy.

Here's why:

A data migration strategy outlines how data will be extracted from the existing system, transformed (if necessary), and loaded into the new system. This is a critical part of any deployment, as it ensures that valuable data is not lost and that the new system can function correctly.
